description: MoldTrans-Tur sued the Chișinău City Hall in administrative litigation.
Autogara Internațională Chișinău co-sued the City Hall in the same matter.
MoldTrans-Tur sued the Municipal Council seeking annulment/obligation to issue favorable act.
Autogara co-sued the Municipal Council in administrative litigation.

source: ASOCIAȚIA DE COPROPRIETARI ÎN CONDOMINIU NR. 55/319
description: The homeowners’ association participated as third party in the case involving MoldTrans-Tur.
The Court of Appeal maintained the 2018 first-instance judgment (7 Feb 2019).
The Supreme Court quashed the 7 Feb 2019 appellate decision (20 Nov 2019).
The Supreme Court also quashed the 6 Aug 2018 first-instance judgment.
The Supreme Court remanded the case for re-trial to the Râșcani seat.
MoldTrans-Tur filed a recourse and requested acceleration; the SCJ set an admissibility hearing and denied acceleration.
Judge Diana Stănilă serves on special panels and has a heavy docket affecting scheduling.
Judge Vitalii Ciumac handled connected cases including 3-4645/2019.
The SCJ invokes ECHR Article 6(1) on reasonable time to justify scheduling.
The Administrative Code governs administrative litigation procedure.
Civil Procedure Code applies supplementarily to administrative actions.
In a separate case, the Court of Appeal admitted the Metropolis’s appeal concerning a 2003 collaboration contract.
The SCJ previously admitted the Metropolis’s recourse and remitted for re-trial (2017).
